Data: Sammy to Watson, 1 run opens the face of the bat and dabs it down to third man
Sammy to Warner, 2 runs swings it in late and he clips it behind square for a couple
Sammy to Warner, 1 run punches it towards long-off for a single
Sammy to Watson, no run a bit too full but it doesn't cost him anything, driven straight to mid-off
Sammy to Watson, 1 run gives him width and he bends his knee and dabs it to third man
Sammy to Warner, 1 run short and wide and he dabs it down to third man
Narine to Warner, no run gets on his knee and sweeps but finds square leg
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs poor delivery, you can't bowl it short to Warner, fetches it from outside off and he pulls wide of Samuels at mid-on
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs like an action replay, wasn't as short but there was a bit of width, he pulls even wider of mid-on
Narine to Warner, 1 run pulls firmly again and it goes to the same area but Samuels is pushed back to the boundary
Narine to Watson, 1 run stays back and punches it to mid-on

Narine to Warner, no run appeal for a catch at slip but the bowler and umpire weren't so sure, spins away from middle and leg and the ball appeared to clip his pad and go to first slip, the catcher and keeper thought they had him
Sammy to Watson, 1 run gives him width again and he cuts wide of point
Sammy to Warner, no run goes back and punches it back to the bowler
Sammy to Warner, no run squares him up a bit with the middle stump line, he softly clips it back to the bowler
Sammy to Warner, 1 run tries to pull on one leg but the ball hurries on him and deflects off his thigh to the leg side
Sammy to Watson, no run slower ball on the pads and he tries to whip it away but can't beat midwicket
Sammy to Watson, no run gets across and chops it down to point
Bravo to Warner, SIX runs that's massive! Bravo errs by dropping it too short, at this pace Warner has time to read the length and club it over deep midwicket
Bravo to Warner, no run goes back at the crease and knocks it softly to the on side
Bravo to Warner, 1 run goes back at the crease and clips it to square leg
Bravo to Watson, no run slower delivery on the off stump and he defends
Bravo to Watson, no run gets well forward and defends towards cover
Bravo to Watson, 1 run slides it on the pads and he clips it behind square on the on side
Sammy to Watson, no run fuller delivery outside off and he drives to the off side
Sammy to Watson, no run gets forward and steers it towards point
Sammy to Watson, no run good length on the stumps and he defends again
Sammy to Watson, 1 leg bye drifts on the pads and he shuffles and works it down to square leg
Sammy to Warner, 1 wide strays wide of the leg stump and wide called
Sammy to Warner, 1 run on the pads and he works it down to square leg
Sammy to Watson, 2 runs short and wide and he chops it wide of point, Charles slides and cuts it off
Narine to Warner, no run goes back at the crease and punches it back to the bowler
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs can't get wickets if he bowls wide and short, Warner rocks back and punches it in front of square, wide of cover and it races it away
Narine to Warner, 1 run a bit short again but he goes back and pulls down to long-on
Narine to Watson, no run comes well forward and defends to the off side
Narine to Watson, no run comes forward and gets an inside edge to the pads
Narine to Watson, no run the leg stump line and it bushes his leg and rolls past the keeper
Sammy to Warner, no run fullish delivery on the stumps and he mistimes the drive to cover
Sammy to Warner, no run bowls it straight and tucks him up for room, he mistimes it back to the bowler
Sammy to Warner, no run stays back and punches it towards mid-off
Sammy to Warner, 1 run drifts on the pads and he clips him towards midwicket for his fifty
Sammy to Watson, 1 run drifts on the pads and he softly works it down to mid-on
Sammy to Warner, FOUR runs streaky! Warner wants to drive it through the off side but gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps and down to fine leg
Narine to Watson, 1 run Watson goes back on off and dabs past slip to short third man
Narine to Warner, no run tossed up outside the left-hander's off stump and he plays over the ball with an attempted sweep shot
Narine to Warner, no run slightly back of a length and nudged to midwicket
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs flighted, on the stumps and Warner goes down on one knee to leather a flat slog-sweep over midwicket
Narine to Warner, 1 run Narine drops his length back and is pulled fiercely to deep square - but some good fielding from Kieron Pollard keeps the damage down to one

Narine to Watson, 2 runs tossed up and smashed out to wide long-on ... where Russell takes a sensational one-handed catch as he leaps over the boundary rope before slam-dunking it back into play before he landed! Great work in the deep, reminiscent of a similar effort by Doherty earlier in the series
Sammy to Warner, FOUR runs width outside off and slapped baseball-style through extra-cover. Warner is cruising here
Sammy to Warner, 1 run outside leg stump and nudged off the hips to deep square
Sammy to Watson, 1 run orthodox line to the right-hander, pushed off the hips
Sammy to Warner, no run keeper up the wicket ... back of a length, cut to cover
Sammy to Warner, 1 run over the wicket now, Warner drives and inside-edges to short leg
Sammy to Watson, 1 run length, outside off, Watson goes back and across and deflects the ball down to third man
Narine to Watson, no run length ball, spinning back in past the bat, into the front pad - but Watson was outside the line
Narine to Watson, FOUR runs tossed up on the stumps and heaved out towards deep midwicket, where it evades a diving fielder before bouncing over the rope
Narine to Watson, 1 run dragged short and pulled through midwicket
Narine to Warner, FOUR runs more punishment for Narine, who is driven viciously through the covers for another boundary - too full in his length and Warner put it away

Narine to Warner, OUT but revenge is a swift as it is sweet! Narine gets his man! This one was just held back a little, Warner suffered a rush of blood to the head and swatted in ungainly fashion across the line, only to loop a thick top edge to short third man. A victim of his own success there, Warner, but credit to Narine for continuing to tos
Narine to Forrest, no run length, outside off and going straight on, defended on the back foot
Russell to Watson, 1 run length, on the legs, turned away behind square
Russell to Forrest, no run pulls it back a touch in length, Forrest puts his hands in the air (like he just don't care) and lets it by
Russell to Forrest, no run again probes outside off, left alone by the batsman
Russell to Forrest, no run length ball, not much room outside off and Forrest doesn't quite have room to cut, bottom-edging the ball in the ground
Russell to Forrest, no run pitched up a bit more, batsman steps out and plays a studied leave
Russell to Forrest, no run on the stumps, comes forward and plays to midwicket
Narine to Watson, no run length, spinning back in from outside off, past the bat and into Watson's midriff, before dropping to safety
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up, worked off his legs to short midwicket
Narine to Watson, no run full, outside off and Watson smothers the ball with a forward defensive
Narine to Watson, no run drifts down the leg side but the batsman can't beat the fielder at square leg with a clip
Narine to Watson, 2 runs touch short from Narine and he is deftly cut past short third man for a couple
Narine to Watson, 1 run on the stumps, worked down the ground to long-on - and that's fifty for Watson, his first of the series
Russell to Watson, 1 run full, on the legs, fiddled out to deep backward square
Russell to Forrest, 1 run length ball, outside off, Forrest squares up and steers the ball to third man
Russell to Watson, 1 run outside off, drifting in, worked off the pads to long leg
Russell to Forrest, 1 run back of a length, Forrest punches to mid-on and scampers through for a single
Russell to Watson, no run gets a bit of bounce off the wicket, defended out towards cover on the back foot
Russell to Watson, 2 runs pitched up, Watson steps out and clips aerially over midwicket
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run length ball, steps out and nudges to midwicket
Samuels to Watson, 1 run drops short outside off, Watson is quickly back and on the hook, slightly mistimed but it lands short of long-on
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run tossed up, clipped to deep backward square
Samuels to Watson, no run length, spinning in from well outside off, dragged down to midwicket
Samuels to Watson, 1 run full toss, driven to long-on
Samuels to Forrest, no run length ball, Forrest shows it the maker's name
Russell to Watson, 1 run short ball, Watson doesn't quite get hold of the attempted hook and it dobbles through midwicket
Russell to Forrest, FOUR runs strays too far down leg and is picked off with a neat glance down to fine leg
Russell to Forrest, 2 runs length, on leg stump, punched short of deep midwicket, though Pollard's arm makes them work hard for two
Russell to Forrest, 1 wide bouncer, Forrest ducks, though he needn't of bothered - wide on height
Russell to Forrest, no run short delivery cut hard to point ... and Sammy throws down the non-striker's end. The crowd erupts - but Watson was comfortably home
Russell to Forrest, no run length, on the stumps and defended
Samuels to Watson, no run full, flighted in towards off, defended on the walk back to the bowler
Samuels to Watson, 1 run driven down the ground to long-on
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run back of a length, flicked of the hips for one
Samuels to Watson, 1 run drifting down leg and again worked to deep backward square
Samuels to Forrest, no run on the stumps and turned back to the bowler

Samuels to Forrest, no run nicely flighted from Samuels, tossed up and skidding on past Forrest's outside edge. Baugh takes off the bails and there's a brief review while they check if the batsman's back foot was grounded. It was
Russell to Watson, 1 run rolled out of the hand, clipped to midwicket
Russell to Forrest, FOUR runs drops short and again veering down leg, scooped off the hips in the air through backward square leg - and Pollard's dive along the rope can't prevent a boundary
Russell to Forrest, no run on the stumps, comes forward and nudges into the leg side
Russell to Forrest, no run length, better line and Forrest again defends into the on side from in front of his wicket
Russell to Forrest, no run line and length outside off, forward defensive rolls to cover
Russell to Forrest, no run slightly shorter, on the stumps, prodded back to the bowler
Samuels to Watson, 1 run tossed up on leg and flicked away to deep square
Samuels to Forrest, no run length, outside off and chopped back to the bowler
Samuels to Forrest, no run on the stumps, turned to micwicket
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run flighted, driven down the ground
Samuels to Watson, no run tossed up outside off and driven to cover
Samuels to Watson, 1 run full, off-stump line, driven to long-off
Russell to Watson, no run length, outside off and defended on the back foot
Russell to Watson, no run similar line, angled in and turned to short midwicket
Russell to Watson, 1 run full, drifting towards off stump, punched down the ground
Russell to Forrest, FOUR runs short ball, directed at the top of Forrest's head but he swivels and top-edges for a four down to the unguarded boundary at fine leg
Russell to Forrest, 1 run length, outside off, driven to the sweeper on the cover boundary
Russell to Watson, 1 run more width outside off, Watson swings through a cut which beats point on the bounce
Samuels to Watson, no run tossed up, driven to cover
Samuels to Watson, no run length, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
Samuels to Watson, 1 run picked up from just outside off and driven down the ground
Samuels to Forrest, no run on the stumps, bit of bounce and Forrest edges to short third man trying to turn the ball to leg
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run driven down the ground to long-off
Samuels to Watson, 1 run flighted outside off, punched to long-off again

Russell to Watson, OUT and now they have one! Russell rolled a bouncer out of his hand and Watson opened the face and guided it to third man like it was on a string. There just wasn't enough pace on it to go all the way ... and Watson, like Warner, fails to go on
Russell to Bailey, 1 run pitched up, outside off, whipped through square leg and Bailey is off the mark
Russell to Forrest, 1 run pushed to cover on the back foot ... but Sammy's shy at the non-striker's end concedes a run
Russell to Bailey, 1 bye leg-stump bouncer that veers even further in the air and Carlton Baugh channels Peter Schmeichel to fingertip the ball round the post/prevent a boundary
Russell to Forrest, 1 run dropped short on the off side and Russell hits the stumps after fielding in his follow-through. He's quite the athlete, this guy
Russell to Bailey, 1 run back of a length, on the stumps, Bailey plays back, patting the to short midwicket
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run tossed up, driven between mid-on and midwicket
Samuels to Forrest, no run flighted in towards the stumps from wide of the crease, driven to mid-off
Samuels to Forrest, no run length ball, dabbed into the off side
Samuels to Forrest, FOUR runs full, Forrest picks it up quickly and crashes a cover drive to the boundary
Samuels to Forrest, no run steady line and length outside off, steered to short third man
Samuels to Forrest, no run on the stumps, pushed to midwicket
Bravo to Bailey, 1 wide flings a loosener down the leg side, which Bailey can't get anything on
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run slower ball, tossed up outside off, clipped in the air through midwicket, the bat turning in Bailey's hands
Bravo to Forrest, no run slightly back of a length, cut to point
Bravo to Forrest, 1 run draws the batsman across outside off, dropped short just off the wicket for a quick single
Bravo to Bailey, 2 runs full length, Bailey shuffles across and shovels off his legs
Bravo to Bailey, 2 runs short and wide, cut hard to deep backward point where Johnson Charles saves a couple with a diving stop
Bravo to Bailey, no run length ball, in the corridor outside off, blocked back to the bowler
Samuels to Forrest, no run goes back and stabs it back to the bowler
Samuels to Forrest, no run gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
Samuels to Forrest, no run gets forward and drives to the off side
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run comes well forward and pushes it towards extra cover
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run gets a leading edge that lobs in front of point
Samuels to Forrest, no run gets forward to defend and he's beaten
Bravo to Bailey, no run moves across and pushes it down to mid-on
Bravo to Bailey, no run mistimes the punch towards point
Bravo to Bailey, FOUR runs excellent shot, Bailey creates an opportunity for a boundary, he knew there was no slip, delicately dabbed it down to third man, the fielder was a bit square
Bravo to Bailey, no run bowls it straighter and he goes back and defends to the on side
Bravo to Bailey, 1 wide drifts wide down the leg side, tries to flick it away
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run stabs it down to long-on for a quick single
Bravo to Forrest, no run good slower ball, he tries to flick it away but the ball hits his thigh and nearly dribbles back to the stumps
Samuels to Bailey, FOUR runs and there's a boundary straightaway, fires it down the leg side and he gets on his knee early and sweeps to fine leg
Samuels to Bailey, no run pushes it quicker, he tries to flick but misses
Samuels to Bailey, no run fires in a yorker and he fails to squirt it out
Samuels to Bailey, no run another yorker and he jams it hard on the pitch and lobs to the bowler
Samuels to Bailey, no run works another full delivery down to mid-on
Samuels to Bailey, no run he opens the face of the bat and steers it to short third man
Roach to Forrest, 1 run short and wide and he fails to put that away, ends up chopping it down to point
Roach to Bailey, 1 run gives him width and he tries to cut and nearly squeezes it past the gap between point and cover, the fielder gets a hand to it
Roach to Forrest, 1 run he opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man

Roach to Bailey, OUT Roach gets a wicket off a full toss, lucky break for the West Indies, Roach angles it in, Bailey tries to clear the infield off a low full toss, can't beat Russell at mid-on, easily taken
Roach to Lee, 1 run gets a quick one on the body and he uneasily fends it off to the on side
Roach to Forrest, no run gets beside the line and steers it to point
Samuels to Lee, no run fires it full again and he jams it back to the bowler
Samuels to Lee, 1 run gets his high backlift down and thuds it to long-off
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run drifts on the body and he clips it down to short fine leg
Samuels to Lee, 1 run another full toss but no second time lucky for West Indies as he slaps it down to long-on
Samuels to Forrest, FOUR runs poor line from Samuels, drifts down the leg side and Forrest gets enough bat to beat short fine leg
Samuels to Forrest, no run tries to work it away to the leg side but the ball clips his pad and rolls to the off side
Roach to Lee, no run makes room and tries to slog him away but he swishes at thin air
Roach to Lee, FOUR runs Lee welcomes the resumption with a boundary, makes room and crashes a length ball over mid-on, not the length to bowl to a pinch-hitter
Roach to Lee, no run Lee makes room to a delivery from round the wicket, beaten for pace and bounce, fails to make contact
Roach to Lee, FOUR runs Roach errs by bowling length again from round the wicket, Lee backs away and swings and gets an outside edge that clears the keeper, one bounce and four
Roach to Lee, 1 run aims for the body and Lee backs away and clips it to the on side
Roach to Forrest, 1 run fuller delivery and he knocks it to the off side
Narine to Forrest, 1 run comes well forward and punches it back to the bowler

Narine to Lee, OUT through the gate! Looked like the off cutter, landed on middle and turned in slightly, clipped the pad and hit the stumps, Lee left a big gap between bat and pad, Roach ran across to congratulate Narine and he ran quite close to Lee
Narine to Hussey, 1 run full outside the off stump and driven to sweeper cover
Narine to Forrest, 2 runs shuffles a long way across and works it with the turn to fine leg
Narine to Forrest, 1 run
Narine to Hussey, no run turns and bounces, Hussey's forced on the back foot and he stabs at it
Roach to Forrest, 1 run drifts on the pads and he shuffles and works it with the angle down to deep midwicket
Roach to Hussey, 1 run angles across the left-hander and he opens the face and steers it down to third man
Roach to Forrest, 1 run fires it on middle and he works it with the angle to the deep again
Roach to Hussey, 1 run shuffles and knocks it to the leg side
Roach to Forrest, 1 run Forrest goes on the back foot and clips it to the on side again, he's picking the singles there
Roach to Hussey, no run forces Hussey on the back foot, he steers it to the off side but can't pinch a single
Narine to Forrest, 1 run makes room and steers it towards third man
Narine to Hussey, 1 run tosses it full on the pads and he gently works it wide of midwicket
Narine to Forrest, 1 run gets well forward and drives towards cover
Narine to Hussey, no run Hussey goes across his stumps and tries to paddle sweep but the ball spins away and knocks him on the body
Narine to Hussey, 1 run drives towards cover for a single
Narine to Forrest, 1 run goes back and punches it towards sweeper cover
Roach to Forrest, 1 run goes back at the crease and knocks it down to midwicket
Roach to Hussey, FOUR runs drops it short, Hussey swivels at the crease and pulls it hard along the ground behind square, he picked a huge gap there
Roach to Hussey, 1 run goes back at the crease and steers him down to third man
Roach to Forrest, 1 run quick low full toss and he punches it down to long-on and that's his half-century
Roach to Hussey, 1 wide drifts wide down the leg side and he tries to flick it away
Roach to Hussey, no run fires it full on the pads and he gets across and whips it towards midwicket
Roach to Hussey, no run full and wide outside the off stump and he smashes it straight to cover, direct hit at the bowler's end but the batsman times his dive well
Narine to Forrest, 1 run sharp turn for Narine, Forrest stays back and just about manages to knock it to the on side
Narine to Hussey, 1 run steers it to point and takes a quick single
Narine to Forrest, 1 run gets to the pitch of the ball and strikes it to long-on
Narine to Hussey, 1 run on the pads and he works it to the on side
Narine to Forrest, 1 run goes back at the crease and pulls him down to midwicket
Narine to Hussey, 1 run gets forward and drives down to sweeper cover
Russell to Hussey, 1 run he's not afraid of pitching it a bit short to Hussey, swivels and pulls in front of square straight to the sweeper
Russell to Forrest, OUT the bowling change works for West Indies, Russell bowls a length ball which rises, short enough to pull but Forrest ends up placing it straight to Roach at midwicket

Russell to Hussey, OUT and Russell is on a hat-trick! He gets David Hussey with a snorter, short delivery which fizzes past the batsman and forces him to weave backwards, Hussey tries to upper cut him over third man but the ball hits the face of the bat and the keeper takes it easily
Russell to Wade, 1 run Wade nudges the hat-trick ball down to third man, there were two slips in place
Russell to Hussey, 1 run short again and he swivels and pulls him to deep midwicket
Russell to Wade, 1 run another gentle nudge down to third man, he beats the diving slip fielder
Samuels to Wade, 1 wide fires it wide down the leg side, fails to get bat on it
Samuels to Wade, no run gets forward and pushes it to the off side
Samuels to Wade, 1 run opens the face of the bat and steers it to third man
Samuels to Hussey, no run angles it across him and he punches it down to point
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run fires it on the pads and he works it down to deep square leg
Samuels to Wade, 1 run inside edge to the on side and he scampers the single
Samuels to Hussey, no run another inside edge and Hussey nearly drags it on to his stumps
Russell to Wade, no run bangs it in short and he weaves out of that fizzer, well bowled again
Russell to Wade, 1 run steers it to the off side and he pinches a quick single, the fielder didn't gather it quickly enough
Russell to Hussey, 1 run drops it with soft hands to the off side and Russell did well to run across the pitch and pick up, the throw was wide of the stumps though and beat the keeper
Russell to Wade, 1 run Russell falls over as he delivers, the batsman works it to the on side
Russell to Hussey, 1 run fires it on the pads and he works it down to square leg
Russell to Wade, 1 run angles it across the left-hander and he works it down to third man, Australia need boundaries
Samuels to Wade, 1 run fullish on the pads and he works it to the on side
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs full on the stumps and he works it wide of midwicket
Samuels to Hussey, no run thats a good yorker, manages to dig it out
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run jams a full delivery down to long-on
Samuels to Wade, 1 run he muscles it down to long-on for a single
Samuels to Hussey, no run that's an appeal for a stumping, Hussey was well forward and was beaten, manages to drag his foot back, the third umpire takes a look
Russell to Wade, FOUR runs makes room and Wade slashes and gets an outside edge that races to third man
Russell to Wade, SIX runs bangs it in short and Wade swivels and clubs it just over Pollard's reach at deep square leg, just enough elevation
Russell to Wade, SIX runs add 6 more! Australia are finally pushing on here, Wade makes room to a shortish delivery and slaps it to the roof at the deep cover boundary, the ball's lost
Russell to Wade, 1 run swings and the ball hits his bat and then his helmet, they take a single
Russell to Hussey, FOUR runs the nightmare gets worse for Russell, he sprays this one full and wide and Hussey makes enough room to thud that wide of deep cover
Russell to Hussey, OUT Russell has something to shout about after the hammering, change of pace, slower ball, Hussey makes room and tries to clear deep midwicket but Pollard's there
Roach to McKay, no run McKay makes room but Roach is too quick for him, he ends up pushing it softly back to the bowler
Roach to McKay, OUT McKay makes a lot of room to swing a short delivery over the on side, didn't time it well and the ball swirled to deep midwicket, Darren Bravo ran forward to take the catch
Roach to Wade, no run Wade tries to get cheeky and plays a reverse paddle but fails to make contact

Roach to Wade, OUT Bravo takes another! This time just inches off the ground, Wade makes room and tries to slap it over deep cover, the ball dips to Bravo and he gets his fingers underneath it even as his hands were touching the turf
Roach to Doherty, 1 run a run at last! Doherty swings and mistimes the pull to long-on
Roach to Hilfenhaus, 1 bye makes room and swings and they scramble a bye, Baugh's throw is to the bowler, Roach breaks the stumps but he's in
Alan will take you through the first 15 overs. Join us in 40 minutes.

1.50pm: The clouds have reappeared at the end of the innings. Ground staff are ready. Not a bad comeback by West Indies but Australia should be pleased with this. It's going to challenge the hosts. If Duckworth-Lewis comes into play, chasing could be more of a challenge. But West Indies are high on confidence. Russell's four wickets and dynamic fielding
Lee to Charles, no run pitched up and swinging away, Charles barely acknowledges its passing through to the keeper
Lee to Charles, no run again nice and full, outside off and moving away, same response from the batsman
Lee to Charles, no run line and length, this one doesn't swing, Charles steps across and shoulder arms
Lee to Charles, no run length, on the stumps this time and Charles gets an edge on to his pads trying to whip to leg
Lee to Samuels, no run length ball, defended on the back foot outside off
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 wide angled across and drifting down the leg side
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run right line from Hilfenhaus, touch of swing away from the right-hander and Barath leaves
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run Hilfenhaus repeats the trick and the batsman leaves again
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run length, outside off, played into the covers
Hilfenhaus to Barath, FOUR runs straight - too straight - and Barath clumps a shot off his legs to the square boundary
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run defended on the back foot outside off
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run slightly back of a length, outside off, inside-edge off a cut pings past the wicket to short leg
Lee to Bravo, no run length, angled across the left-hander and defended
Lee to Bravo, no run straighter line, attacking the stumps, Bravo gets in line and defends solidly
Lee to Bravo, no run length, drifting across then seaming back a touch, left by the batsman
Lee to Bravo, no run quick and bouncy, almost wicket to wicket, defended on the back foot towards cover-point
Lee to Bravo, no run beauty of a delivery, slightly full, enticing Bravo forwards and then seaming away, blowing kisses at the outside edge of the bat on its way past
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run bumper from Hilfenhaus, slammed in short and directed at the batsman - Barath drops the hands and takes evasive action
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run length, in the corridor outside off, defended

Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run a shocker from Hilfenhaus, who delivers the ball about five yards down the pitch - it bounces several times then rolls off the cut strip but is called dead ball, rather than wide. Barath defends the follow-up
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run leg-stump line and clipped to deep backward square
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run angled across, defended out to point
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 wide down the leg side, wrong line to the lefty
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, touch of movement back in as Bravo leaves
Lee to Barath, no run length, defended on the back foot outside off
Lee to Barath, no run on the stumps, nudged into the leg side
Lee to Barath, no run shorter ball, wide and swinging further - Barath attempts to uppercut but can't lay bat on it
Lee to Barath, no run straighter line of attack, goes back and across to defend towards mid-on
Lee to Barath, no run length ball, off-stump line and nipping back a little, edged into the leg side as Barath pushes forward
Lee to Barath, no run back of a length, left as the ball swings away from outside off
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run on the legs, clipped square but straight to the fielder
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run back of a length, defended on the back foot in front of the stumps
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length ball, angled across outside off and pushed to cover
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run drops short, targeting the batsman's ribs, jabbed short on the leg side
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run teasing length, drifting across Bravo, who stands back and swishes in the wind
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run off-stump line, driven to cover
Lee to Barath, no run pacy, line and length outside off, Barath hops back and dabs to point
Lee to Barath, no run length delivery, on off stump and Barath shows it the full face of the bat in defence
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs runs, at last! Lee drops short and wide and Barath opens his arms to club a cut short high over point. Is that the end of the hoodoo?
Lee to Barath, no run back on that off-stump line, blocked on the back foot
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs he goes again, picking up a full-length delivery and chipping it over mid-off. It connected near the bottom of the bat but there was enough power to carry it to the rope
Lee to Barath, no run full, on the legs, clipped to midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 run back of a length and cut, via a top edge down to third man
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run defended in front of the stumps
Hilfenhaus to Barath, FOUR runs drops short and swung meatily over square leg, not the cleanest connection again but it beats the chasing fielder's dive to reach the boundary
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run on the stumps, slightly back of a length delivery that Barath pushes into a gap at midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run pitched up outside off, Bravo smacks a golf-style cover drive straight at the fielder
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run on the legs and flicked wristily to midwicket where Mike Hussey makes a diving stop
McKay to Barath, no run medium pace, on a length outside off, Barath watches it through
McKay to Barath, no run back of a length, angled in, punched short towards midwicket and the batsmen decide against running
McKay to Barath, no run Barath leans out and defends a length ball to cover
McKay to Barath, FOUR runs too wide from McKay and he's not quick enough to get away with it ... Barath swings heartily through it, spanking a cut over point for four
McKay to Barath, no run tighter line and the batsman lets this one go through to the keeper
McKay to Barath, no run back of a length ball, wide of off but swinging back and Barath raises his arms to leave
Watson to Bravo, no run ambles in, length ball outside off, punched to point off the back foot
Watson to Bravo, 1 run slanted across the left-hander, slashed via a thickish edge to third man
Watson to Barath, no run banged in on the batsman's body, dropped short on the leg side and Bravo, at the non-striker's end, declines a run
Watson to Barath, no run good length, defended square outside off stump
Watson to Barath, no run high arm action, tight line, Barath hops back and defends
Watson to Barath, 1 leg bye line drifts across to the leg side and the batsmen nick a leg bye as the run dribbles away off the pad
McKay to Barath, no run length delivery left alone outside off stump
McKay to Barath, no run pushed through outside off, again Barath's not biting
McKay to Barath, no run maintains that line and length, Barath defends into the off side
McKay to Barath, no run pitched up a little more and Barath whips his hands through, doesn't middle the drive and it runs to mid-off
McKay to Barath, FOUR runs shorter delivery, outside off but Barath swivels like a ballerina and hammers a hook shot over midwicket for a one-bounce four
McKay to Barath, 1 run fuller length, driven in the air this time, over cover to the sweeper in the deep
Watson to Barath, no run length, defended on the back foot in front of off stump
Watson to Barath, 1 wide banged in short and climbing like King Kong up the Empire State to be called wide on height
Watson to Barath, 2 runs taken from outside off and steered past the diving point fielder for a couple
Watson to Barath, no run length ball, driven square into the off side on the back foot
Watson to Barath, no run on the stumps, studied defensive shot from Barath, whose playing very nicely now
Watson to Barath, 1 run leg-stump line and eased around the corner
Watson to Bravo, 1 run length ball, guided from just outside off down to third man
McKay to Bravo, no run angled across Bravo, driven to mid-off

McKay to Bravo, OUT he's gone, feathering through to the keeper! Bravo's struggles had been masked by the giddy hitting at the other end but, after scratching around for 20 deliveries, Bravo attempted another glide to third man and nicked off. He's out of there and West Indies slide further into trouble ...
McKay to Bravo, no run beaten outside off, fencing at one as he played back
McKay to Bravo, no run length, seaming back towards the batsman, Bravo lifts his bat high into the air
McKay to Bravo, FOUR runs fuller, straighter ball and Bravo is more comfortable with that, punching the ball off his legs in front of midwicket and the ball scuttles away to the rope
McKay to Bravo, 1 run back of a length, nudged square on the leg side
Watson to Bravo, no run length, outside off, Bravo plays forward with bat and pad, pushing the ball out to point
Watson to Bravo, no run angled into the right-hander, worked towards midwicket
Watson to Bravo, no run pitched up a touch, Bravo steps outside the line of off and checks a drive to mid-on coming in from the edge of the circle
Watson to Bravo, no run back of a length this time, dropped towards cover
Watson to Bravo, 1 run on the stumps, touch short, flipped off the hips through midwicket for one
Watson to Barath, 1 run good length outside off, Barath pushes forwards and gets an inside edge to square leg
McKay to Barath, 1 run nagging line and length outside off, deflected to third man with soft hands pressing forward
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs squeezed away square on the leg side from outside off as Bravo edges across and closes the face
McKay to Bravo, no run length, pushed into the off side
McKay to Bravo, no run on the stumps and worked to short midwicket
McKay to Bravo, no run slower delivery, well outside off and Bravo holds the pose, bat the air, as it trundles through
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs short and wide, spanked dismissively through point, with Robo Cricketer Mike Hussey running round to make a smart stop in the deep
Watson to Barath, 1 run touch short, on the batsman's body, jabbed away to square leg hopping back by Barath
Watson to Bravo, no run on the legs, flicked away ... but directed straight to short fine leg, who prevents a run
Watson to Bravo, 1 run pitched up outside off, driven with flourish but well stopped by George Bailey at short extra-cover, preventing further damage
Watson to Barath, no run shorter, pushed towards cover
Watson to Barath, no run angled in towards the stumps, solidly blocked back to the bowler
Watson to Barath, no run length ball, popping up and defended by Bravo, the ball dropping on to the wicket between his legs
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run makes a bit of room and drives down to long-off
Doherty to Barath, no run tossed up on middle and off and Barath defends
Doherty to Barath, 1 run much quicker through the air and he taps it to the on side
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run Bravo uses his feet and whips it to the on side
Doherty to Barath, no run gets forward and drives firmly back to the bowler
Doherty to Barath, 1 wide sprays it wide down the leg side, tries to sweep but misses
Doherty to Barath, no run just opens the face and steers it towards point
Watson to Bravo, 1 run fullish delivery on the pads and he clips it wide of mid-on
Watson to Barath, 1 run gets forward and steers it to the off side
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs a boundary to break the shackles, pitched up outside the off stump, Bravo leans forward and lofts high over mid-off
Watson to Bravo, 1 run goes back at the crease and tucks him to the on side
Watson to Barath, 1 run
Doherty to Barath, no run comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
Doherty to Barath, no run steers it to the off side and they decide against the single
Doherty to Barath, 1 run forces a low full toss down to long-on
Doherty to Pollard, no run gets an inside edge onto his boot on the drive
Doherty to Pollard, no run opens the face of the bat and steers it to backward point
Doherty to Pollard, no run goes back at the crease and punches it down to short extra cover
Watson to Barath, no run half-hearted appeal for a caught behind by Wade, he tries to dab it down to third man but the bat hit the pad, good decision by Dharmasena
Watson to Barath, no run full delivery on the stumps and he mistimes the drive to mid-off
Watson to Barath, no run bowls it straight and tucks him up, he defends
Watson to Barath, no run miscued pull and it just lands in front of a diving McKay at mid-on, Barath didn't connect properly
Watson to Barath, 1 wide drifts wide down the leg side and wide called
Watson to Barath, 1 run gets forward and thrashes it past cover, the sweeper's there
Watson to Pollard, no run Pollard gets forward and quietly knocks it back to the bowler
Doherty to Barath, 1 run comes forward and pushes it softly towards cover and sets off, good calling
Doherty to Pollard, no run defends towards point and takes a few paces out of his crease, heads back
Doherty to Pollard, no run bowls it flat and straight, not much he could do but defend
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs Pollard gives the charge and lofts down to long-on, Bailey was at a straight-hit position but Pollard managed to loft it wide of him, quite an unusual field setting
Doherty to Pollard, no run tossed up outside off, he gets forward and defends
Doherty to Pollard, no run gets well forward and defends
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run hurries on to him, he tries to nudge it away but the ball clips his pads and rolls away
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run a bit short and he's tucked up for room, opens the face and runs it down to third man
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run bowls it straight again, good line and Pollard quietly defends it
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run the stump-to-stump line is stifling Pollard, once again he softly pushes it down the track
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, 1 run shorter delivery on the body and Pollard knocks it to the on side for a quick single
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run opens the face and runs it down to third man
Doherty to Barath, 1 run
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run runs it down towards fine leg
Doherty to Barath, no run he gets forward and defends towards point
Doherty to Barath, no run pushes it towards cover
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs tossed up on the pads and Pollard whips it with intent over a diving midwicket, the fielder was quite close, plenty of power behind that shot
Hilfenhaus to Baugh, 1 run bit risky there, the first slip was wide and yet he steered it just wide of him
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run gets across and taps it back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run Hilfenhaus bowls it straight again and Pollard can only clip it back down the pitch
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run follows that up with a sharp bouncer, Pollard doesn't offer a shot
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run keeps him on the back foot and he defends back to the bowler
Doherty to Baugh, no run Baugh lunges forward and steers it down towards point
Doherty to Baugh, no run comes well forward and defends again
Doherty to Baugh, no run another forward defense, another dot ball
Doherty to Baugh, no run make that four in a row, Baugh goes back and defends
Doherty to Baugh, no run five dot balls, he stays back and punches it towards point
Doherty to Baugh, 1 run clips the last delivery to the on side and keeps the strike
McKay to Baugh, no run tucks him up for room and he pushes it firmly to the packed off-side field
McKay to Baugh, 1 run gets half forward and steers it past the gap at cover, Pollard back on strike
McKay to Pollard, no run stays beside the line and taps it to the off side

McKay to Pollard, 1 run drops it to the off side and risks a single, great attempt by Warner to slide and under-arm the ball towards the stumps in one motion, the ball was just wide of the stumps, the batsman was short of his ground
McKay to Baugh, no run big slash outside off and he misses, no foot movement there
McKay to Baugh, FOUR runs that's more like it, wide outside off and he waits for the ball to come on to him before cutting wide of point
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs that's the Pollard we know! Tossed up outside off and he stays at the crease and lofts crisply just over the wide long-off fielder
Doherty to Pollard, no run
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs didn't exactly time it as well as he would have liked but it still carried over wide long-on, raw power, he stayed at the crease and slogged
Doherty to Pollard, no run comes over the wicket, bowls it flat and Pollard defends
Doherty to Pollard, no run fires another flat delivery and he taps it back to the bowler
Doherty to Pollard, 2 runs whips it away close to his pads and picks the gap deep on the on side
McKay to Baugh, no run fullish outside the off stump and driven down to mid-off
McKay to Baugh, 1 run wide outside off and Baugh repeats the square cut that fetched him the boundary, Lee is square at third man so he cuts it off
McKay to Pollard, 1 run on the pads and he clips it down to short fine leg, the fielder slides and stops it
McKay to Baugh, no run
McKay to Baugh, FOUR runs crisp timing! Baugh picks the big gap wide of cover and plays another neat cut, McKay feeding him width again
McKay to Baugh, no run punches this firmly to the off side
Lee to Pollard, 1 run goes back at the crease and taps it to the leg side
Lee to Baugh, 1 run squares him up on the off stump and he gets an outside edge down to third man
Lee to Pollard, 1 run tucks him up for room and he pushes it to the off side again
Lee to Baugh, no run Lee tests him out again by bowling it straight on the stumps, manages to get his bat behind in time
Lee to Baugh, no run defends in front of the stumps again, it's another quiet over in the making

Lee to Baugh, OUT a collision! Wade unfortunately has hurt himself! Ouch, that will sting. Baugh tried to go for broke over the leg side, not sure where he was aiming but he got a top edge that swirled high down to fine leg, it was Hilfenhaus' catch all the way but Wade ran across from his position, two fielders claiming it, Hilfy managed to hang
McKay to Russell, 1 run pushes it to the off side and Bailey stops it
McKay to Pollard, 1 run swinging in on the stumps and he clips it down to midwicket
McKay to Russell, no run he beats him outside the off stump, tried to run it down to third man
McKay to Russell, 1 run bangs it in short and he pulls firmly to deep square leg
McKay to Pollard, no run tucks him up for room and he pushes it to the off side field
McKay to Pollard, 1 run leading edge but it's safe of the fielders
Lee to Pollard, no run beats him outside off, he prods forward but was beaten for pace
Lee to Pollard, no run teases him with width but Pollard opts to leave it alone
Lee to Pollard, no run beats him again, he pitches it up a bit more and Pollard was forward and across to drive, not far from the edge
Lee to Pollard, no run fullish in length outside off and he pushes it wide of cover

Lee to Pollard, 2 runs fends off a shortish delivery and the ball dribbles towards Wade, they take a quick single and Wade hits the stumps at the other end but they steal an overthrow off the ricochet
Lee to Pollard, 1 run squares him up and he gets an outside edge down towards third man
Watson to Russell, FOUR runs Russell sees a big gap at wide long-on and slaps a short delivery to that region, West Indies can only play in one gear now
Watson to Russell, no run taps it to the off side
Watson to Russell, no run firm punch square of the wicket and the point fielder dives and stops it
Watson to Russell, 1 run steered with soft hands down to third man
Watson to Sammy, no run swing and a miss outside off, no foot movement
Doherty to Russell, 1 run low full toss and he gets on his knee and smacks it straight to deep square leg
Doherty to Sammy, SIX runs low full toss and Sammy stays at the crease and has a golf swing, over long-on, raw power
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run comes forward and drives firmly to the off side
Doherty to Russell, no run goes back and tries to slash that past point but he doesn't get the placement right
Doherty to Russell, 1 run comes forward and drives to cover
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run fired on the pads and he whips it to the on side
Watson to Sammy, 1 run length, outside off, slashed to cover
Watson to Russell, 1 run punched through to covers to the man in the deep
Watson to Sammy, no run on the body, nurdled short on the leg side but too tight for a run
Watson to Sammy, FOUR runs room outside off, guided with a flick of the wrists down to the third man boundary
Watson to Sammy, 1 run full toss, clubbed out to wide long-on
Watson to Russell, no run length ball, rising steeply as Russell goes back in his crease and misses out with an attempted cut
Lee to Sammy, 1 run length ball, scooped from off stump out to deep midwicket where it bounces 15 yards or so in front of the fielder
Lee to Russell, 1 run pushed to cover for a quick single, the throw from Doherty missing the stumps
Lee to Sammy, FOUR runs fullish length, outside off, Sammy gives himself room and batters a full-blooded swing straight back down the ground for four
Lee to Sammy, no run pitched up again and driven hard to extra-cover
Lee to Sammy, FOUR runs full toss on the legs, Sammy only has to get a slice of willow on it and it races down to fine leg

Lee to Sammy, SIX runs my, oh my, Sammy has dumped Lee into the car park over deep midwicket! It was another rank full-bunger and the West Indies captain connected sweetly as he hefted through the on side. Why is he coming in at No. 9?!
Hilfenhaus to Russell, 1 run length ball, pushed to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Sammy, 1 run pitched up and Sammy swings murderously through the ball, taking a single out to the cover boundary
Hilfenhaus to Russell, FOUR runs wide yorker from Hilfenhaus, steered neatly behind point, using the pace of the ball to send it bowling away to the rope
Hilfenhaus to Russell, 1 run pitched up, driven to extra-cover and Russell goes tumbling over as his makes it to the non-striker's end
Hilfenhaus to Sammy, 1 run full, outside off, drilled to long-off
Hilfenhaus to Russell, no run pitched up, Russell goes big but doesn't quite connect, the ball trickling back to the bowler
McKay to Sammy, FOUR runs full, wide of off but Sammy has long arms and he drags another meaty swing down the ground - that brings up the 50 partnership, in just 30 balls
McKay to Sammy, 1 run dropped? Yes, I think so, though it was a tough caught and bowled chance, as Sammy slashed a full-pitched ball back past McKay, whose outstretched fingers couldn't cling on
McKay to Russell, 1 run full again, dug out down to long-on
McKay to Sammy, SIX runs another massive heave from Sammy, swinging across the line and sending McKay over wide long-on

McKay to Sammy, SIX runs that's a monstrous blow and it takes Sammy to the brink of fifty from 19 balls! McKay tried to get it up in the blockhole but Sammy got right underneath it and hammed the ball over deep midwicket. Carnage!
McKay to Sammy, FOUR runs pitched up again and drilled down the ground! The shot bisects long-on and long-off and takes Sammy past 50 from 20 balls, equalling his own West Indian record
Watson to Russell, FOUR runs and the punishment contiues, Russell smearing a full toss over point and away for four more!
Watson to Russell, no run pitched up full and wide, this time Russell can't get his bat on it
Watson to Russell, 1 run yorker-length, dug out to point and they sneak a single
Watson to Sammy, no run length ball, drilled back to the bowler
Watson to Sammy, no run superb yorker, Sammy jams his bat down and ends up off his feet due to the momentum
Watson to Sammy, 1 run swung hard down the ground but that's just a single to long-on
Doherty to Sammy, no run tossed up, outside off, hacked back to the bowler
Doherty to Sammy, SIX runs slammed down the ground and David Hussey and long-off can only tip it further over the rope as he leaps in the air desperately
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run turned off the stumps through midwicket
Doherty to Russell, no run flighted up and missed with a swipe outside off
Doherty to Russell, 1 run chipped back over the bowler's head but reeled in at long-off
Doherty to Sammy, no run on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Russell, no run length, tucked into the leg side
Hilfenhaus to Russell, 1 run slower ball, short and wide, rocks back and cuts through point
Hilfenhaus to Sammy, 1 run full-pitched delivery on leg stump, punched down the ground
Hilfenhaus to Russell, FOUR runs picked up outside off and boomed back down the ground, beating Warner at long-off - that's a new West Indies record for the eighth wicket
Hilfenhaus to Russell, FOUR runs full on the leg side and deftly clipped behind backward square for another boundary. Russell is emulating Sammy now!
Hilfenhaus to Russell, 1 run pitched up again - as if it matters - and driven to long-off
Doherty to Russell, FOUR runs too full and slashed hard through point. The water is no longer falling from the sky but it's raining runs and Australia are being swamped!
Doherty to Russell, 1 run pushed through a bit quicker, nudged to cover
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run tossed up, driven down the ground for one
Doherty to Russell, 2 runs flighted, steps back and creamed wide of long-off - they get back for two and that brings up the hundred partnership!
Doherty to Russell, no run length, on the stumps, Russell goes for a slog-sweep and is hit on the body

Doherty to Russell, OUT forward press on the stumps, Australia appeal for lbw - they're going to review it. The question is whether it was bat or pad first ... the side camera angle suggests pad, and the ball was going on to hit ... Russell is gone and Doherty has claimed a potentially crucial wicket! Russell goes for a rapid 41, ending a century
McKay to Sammy, 1 run length, nudged into the leg side. Have the bowlers decided that pitching it up is no longer the plan?
McKay to Narine, 1 run length delivery, angling in, driven past extra-cover for a single to bring Sammy back on strike
McKay to Sammy, 1 run back of a length outside off, Sammy ticks it to square leg
McKay to Narine, FOUR runs back around the wicket ... thick edge but it flies through the vacant first slip area, past Wade's acrobatic lunge
McKay to Narine, no run back of a length, Narine has a swish with the bat well away from his body but misses
McKay to Narine, no run short again, cramping the batsman, who fences uncertainly - that's another precious dot for McKay and Australia
Doherty to Sammy, no run tossed up, Sammy works it to point but doesn't try for a run
Doherty to Sammy, 2 runs picked up from a fullish length and humped down the ground, they take on the fielder's arm and get two
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run flatter delivery, Sammy cuts hard to the cover boundary
Doherty to Narine, no run drifted across the left-hander, beating the outside edge and drawing excited noises from Wade
Doherty to Narine, no run length, outside off, pushed to cover
Doherty to Narine, no run on the stumps, dragged down a touch, defended on the to wicket
McKay to Sammy, no run pitched up from McKay, on the legs and Sammy misses out, the ball hitting the pad and remaining on the cut strip. The batsman shakes his fist in frustration
McKay to Sammy, 1 run full length, driven out past cover this time, again Sammy unable to get underneath it
McKay to Narine, no run length, on the stumps, Narine steps away and swings his arms through a drive that skitters to mid-off and there's no run
McKay to Narine, 2 runs slightly short, outside off but pulled over the on side, into the vacant deep midwicket area, with deep square leg running around to field
McKay to Sammy, 1 run short, scraped away through point
Lee to Sammy, no run pacy yorker, dug out into the off side
Lee to Sammy, 1 run room outside off for Sammy to swing, they get a single after a misfield at cover
Lee to Roach, no run aimed right up into the slot, but sliding down leg, flicking the pad on the way through to Wade, who can't cling on anyway
Lee to Roach, no run well-directed bouncer from Lee and the batsman ducks under it as it veers down the leg side - not called wide though
Lee to Roach, 1 run length, targeting the stumps, Roach squeezes a single out to deep backward square leg
Lee to Sammy, 1 run pitched up and Sammy squirts the ball out to third man to retain the strike
Watson to Sammy, no run slower ball, on the stumps and dinked back to the bowler, unable to make anything of it
Watson to Sammy, FOUR runs drifts on to the legs and Sammy times the ball to the deep backward square boundary. The flame flickers
Watson to Sammy, 1 run length ball, clipped through the infield to the cover boundary
Watson to Roach, no run line and length from Watson, Roach gets behind the ball and defends to cover
Watson to Roach, 1 wide slings one down the leg side - a freebie for West Indies
Watson to Roach, no run outside off, defended back to the bowler
Lee to Sammy, no run length ball, goes for a big ole swing of the arms but fails to connect
Lee to Sammy, 1 run pitched up and shovelled out to deep midwicket but there's a man there and they can only take one
Lee to Roach, 1 run length, targeting the stumps, Roach gets across and nudges into the leg side
Lee to Sammy, SIX runs he goes again, another six! Play it again, Sammy! Lee sent down a slow bouncer but Sammy read it, stayed back in the crease and hoicked the ball over deep square leg
Lee to Sammy, no run pitched up this time and Sammy gets right behind it to block
Lee to Sammy, 1 run full, almost yorker-length, slanted into the batsman, dug out towards deep midwicket and a superb stop prevents it going for four ... Sammy keeps the strike, though
Hilfenhaus to Sammy, no run full, right in the blockhole, Sammy digs it out, it squirms past the bowler but they decide not to take a single

Hilfenhaus to Sammy, OUT full, heaved away into the leg side once again ... but this time he finds a fielder. Sammy perishes in the deep and West Indies suffer heroic defeat! He swung hard but this time without quite the same venom, looping a high catch to Mike Hussey at deep square leg. A valiant innings from the captain but his side fall short

Minor quibbles aside, it's been a terrific series, closely fought (all but one match went down to the final few overs) and with some cracking individual contributions. Australia have underwhelmed slightly but salvaged some pride at the end; their 17-year unbeaten record in ODI series against West Indies remains intact. In the performances of Kieron Poll
That, folks, is a wrap. Cheers for your comments, we'll be back for more of the same for the first of two T20 internationals on Tuesday.
Australia won by 30 runs
Player of the match is Daren Sammy, WI
